**The Mantle of Heaven** is one of the [quest artifacts](/wiki/Quest_artifact "Quest artifact") for the [Noble role](/wiki/Noble "Noble"), implemented in [dNetHack](/wiki/DNetHack "DNetHack") and [SlashTHEM](/wiki/SlashTHEM "SlashTHEM").

In [dNetHack](/wiki/DNetHack "DNetHack") it is the quest artifact specifically for [human](/wiki/Human "Human") and [incantifier](/wiki/Incantifier_\(starting_race\) "Incantifier (starting race)") Nobles. [Vampiric](/wiki/Vampire_\(starting_race\) "Vampire (starting race)") Nobles share the same [quest](/wiki/Quest "Quest") design but seek [the Vestment of Hell](/wiki/The_Vestment_of_Hell "The Vestment of Hell") as their goal instead.

[Elven](/wiki/Elf_\(starting_race\) "Elf (starting race)"), [drow](/wiki/Drow_\(starting_race\)#dNethack "Drow (starting race)"), and [dwarven](/wiki/Dwarf_\(starting_race\) "Dwarf (starting race)") Nobles have different, race-specific quests and quest artifacts (see the [Noble](/wiki/Noble "Noble") main article for more details).

The Mantle is [lawful](/wiki/Lawful "Lawful") for [wishing](/wiki/Wishing "Wishing") and [bones](/wiki/Bones "Bones") purposes.

## dNetHack

In dNetHack the Mantle is an artifact [ornamental cope](/wiki/Ornamental_cope "Ornamental cope") which grants [cold resistance](/wiki/Cold_resistance "Cold resistance") when carried, and [shock resistance](/wiki/Shock_resistance "Shock resistance") and [half spell damage](/wiki/Half_spell_damage "Half spell damage") when worn, *in addition to* whatever benefit is provided by the [cloak](/wiki/Cloak "Cloak") with the "ornamental cope" [randomized appearance](/wiki/Randomized_appearance "Randomized appearance") in the game: [displacement](/wiki/Cloak_of_displacement "Cloak of displacement"), [invisibility](/wiki/Cloak_of_invisibility "Cloak of invisibility"), [magic resistance](/wiki/Cloak_of_magic_resistance "Cloak of magic resistance"), [protection](/wiki/Cloak_of_protection "Cloak of protection"). Also, its [armor class](/wiki/Armor_class "Armor class") is double that of its base item.

Wearing the Mantle also allows the Noble to #sit in the special [throne](/wiki/Throne "Throne") in the [ancestral keep](/wiki/Noble_quest#Home_level "Noble quest") for a number of perks, including a free [wish](/wiki/Wish "Wish"), a [genocide](/wiki/Genocide "Genocide"), some random [pets](/wiki/Pet "Pet") and an [identification](/wiki/Identification "Identification").

### Strategy

As the Mantle has a randomized cloak as its base item, its usefulness may vary between games. While there are no cloaks with randomized appearances in dNetHack that are a liability to their wearer, some cloak types may be especially useful combined with the other extrinsics of the Mantle. If its base item is a [cloak of protection](/wiki/Cloak_of_protection "Cloak of protection"), then the Mantle adds a formidable base of six points to your AC plus enchantment and maximum [magic cancellation](/wiki/Magic_cancellation "Magic cancellation"), eliminating the need for [Victorian underwear](/wiki/Shirt#Noble_Role "Shirt"). Other base cloaks offer only two points of base AC and MC2, but [displacement](/wiki/Displacement "Displacement"), [invisibility](/wiki/Invisibility "Invisibility"), or [magic resistance](/wiki/Magic_resistance "Magic resistance") may still be desirable extrinsics in addition to the default cold and shock resistance, and half spell damage.

The [Rod of Lordly Might](/wiki/Rod_of_Lordly_Might "Rod of Lordly Might") (scepter/first [sacrifice gift](/wiki/Sacrifice_gift "Sacrifice gift")), the Mantle of Heaven (robe/quest artifact), and the [Crown of the Saint King](/wiki/DNetHack_Artifacts#The_Crown_of_the_Saint_King "DNetHack Artifacts") (coronet/[crowning](/wiki/Crowning "Crowning") gift) complete the Human or Incantifier Noble's regalia.

## References

Reference: [Chris' Noble Patch](https://github.com/Chris-plus-alphanumericgibberish/dnethack/commit/980737c5e4fca9299af8f797d159182f7c2bc242)
